revised_title: Planar Motion Mechanism in Ship Model Testing
tldr: The authors present a new approach to the planar motion mechanism in ship model testing, using oscillatory coefficients instead of slow motion derivatives. This technique allows for more accurate measurements of hydrodynamic forces and can be applied to submarines and surface ships. The planar motion mechanism is a powerful tool for testing models of ships and submarines, and this new approach offers a more versatile and economical method for measuring hydrodynamic forces.
